p: RBX1 contributes to the G1 phase-specific degradation of Exonuclease 1 (EXO1), which is responsible for the protruding 3â€² single stranded DNA formation during processing of double-strand breaks. RBX1 knockdown decreases the degradation of EXO1 [ 72], and its depletion causes radiosensibilization of cervical cancer cells and deficiency in DNA double-strand breaks repair [ 72].
